resources.string: INVASION OF ARTEMIS
The Invasion of Artemis

Morgaine requests your assistance to battle the Ancient Huntress Artemis and the Angry Earth in Elysian Wilds. Collect seeds for an inoculate to enter and then work with the rangers and druids of the region to assess the enemy.
<g id="female_worry" priority="high" />The furious vengeance of the Angry Earth has ravaged First Light. <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />We should have seen this coming. I should have seen this coming.
<g id="female_sighBigRelief" priority="high"/>I was looking forward to spending weeks poring over these dusty tomes. Seems that will have to wait for some time <g id="male_throwarms" />now. Feh!

<g id="female_impatient" priority="high" />After hearing from Imhotep what transpired here, I now realize what's happening in First Light<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />… the vengeance of Artemis, it seems.
"She wants to destroy humanity."
<g id="female_covermouthShocked" />To think that one of the Ancients walked among us all this time! Huh! And you managed to prevent her awakening Sutekh! <g id="male_ragepunchfistsdown" />Such chaos!
I was a fool to ignore signs<g id="male_quidproquo" /> Adiana wasn't merely an aloof Huntress making veiled threats.
<g id="female_lookDownGuilty" />Defying an Ancient's will to tap the Motherwell against Corruption has kindled her wrath, <g id="female_fingerwagNo" />and First Light pays the price.
"We had no choice."

<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" priority="high" />It's often acts committed in desperation that lead to even more desperate consequences, <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />but we console ourselves thus.
<g id="male_explain" />And now we must arrest the Angry Earth's vengeance,<g id="female_fingerwagNo" /> else First Light is only the beginning.
"We need to strike back."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Aye, a horrific transformation unfolds beyond the Bramble Wall.<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" /> I accompanied the druids to witness it myself.
<g id="female_theseidiots" />But they are too busy looking at trees to see this goes beyond any forest. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />We need you there, Soulwarden.
"How do I get past the brambles?"
<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />Bah! Parting the brambles is easy! <g id="male_explain" />But the air beyond is befouled with noxious spores, and we must prepare.
<g id="male_explain" />The Angry Earth nearby carry the key element of the inoculate - <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />gather their seeds while I prepare the brew.
<g id="male_quidproquo" />I was a fool to ignore signs Adiana wasn't merely an aloof Huntress making veiled threats.
<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" priority="high" />Defying an Ancient's will to tap the Motherwell against Corruption has kindled her wrath, <g id="female_lookDownGuilty" />and First Light pays the price.
"We had no choice."
<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" priority="high" />It's often acts committed in desperation that lead to even more desperate consequences, but we console ourselves thus.
<g id="male_explain" />And now we must arrest the Angry Earth's vengeance, else First Light is only the beginning.
"We need to strike back."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Aye, a horrific transformation unfolds beyond the Bramble Wall.<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" /> I accompanied the druids to witness it myself.
<g id="female_theseidiots" />But they are too busy looking at trees to see this goes beyond any forest. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />We need you there, Soulwarden.
"How do I get past the brambles?"
<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />Bah! Parting the brambles is easy! <g id="male_explain" />But the air beyond is befouled with noxious spores, and we must prepare.
<g id="male_explain" />The Angry Earth nearby carry the key element of the inoculate - <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />gather their seeds while I prepare the brew.
<g id="female_clasphandsConvince" />Collect those seeds, young one. Artemis wastes not a<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" priority="high" /> moment and neither shall we.

<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Aha! I forgot how refreshing it is to work with one so efficient. <g id="male_dismissGetLost1" priority="high" />A day's work with those incompetent druids takes a full week.
<g id="male_gestureBackThere" priority="high" />The seeds you gathered are for them; I already had enough for your inoculate. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />Here… quaff it quickly.
"After this, I can pass through the wall?"

<g id="male_headNodYes" />Aye, and breathe freely within! <g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />I shall go ahead and mark the way, and you can meet me at the encampment just within the territory.
<g id="female_impatient" priority="high" />We'll have to endure the insufferable druids together, <g id="male_headShakeNo" />they're all we have for support.
<g id="female_impatient" priority="high" />This encampment sits at the edge of an unfolding apocalypse, <g id="male_dismissRegal" priority="high" />but I'm the only one who seems to realize that.
<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Heh. You've been inoculated against the noxious spores, but I have <g id="male_waghand03" />nothing to ward off the ignorance of fools.
<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />Be wary; some in this camp cannot grasp how little they know, nor will they welcome your counsel.
"We still need to work with them."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Aye, we must humor them for the time being, at least. <g id="female_explainS" />Share the inoculate with Archdruid Trahern first, we need him healthy.
<g id="female_explainS" />Then speak with Alchemist Eadred. <g id="male_headNodYes" />He has more sense than the others.
<g id="male_gestureAhead" />Speak with the others in the camp, as well.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> You'll see why we've made little progress.
<g id="female_lookaroundWonder" />This is wild nature magic. The power Artemis must wield... A foul wind blows over from the southeast. I fear Light’s Crown is the heart of this travesty.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Hail, Soulwarden. Deep peace to you. Your arrival is a healthy wind in this struggling encampment.
<g id="male_itemTakeRight" priority="high" />Is that the inoculate Morgaine promised? <g id="male_laugh" />Well now, that's the first kindness from her since we met.
"She wanted you to have it first."

<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />That is a... surprise, but I must refuse. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />There are others whose need is far greater. Seems everyone has a different tolerance to these spores.
<g id="male_convince01" />Please, if you will, share the inoculate with those who've fallen ill.
<g id="female_explainS" />The flora and fauna of this region have fallen completely under Artemis's influence. <g id="female_smackfist" />If we are to prevail, we must master nature itself.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Ah, the hero Morgaine predicted would come! And is that the inoculate she promised? I'll take it, though I trust little from that Sorceress.
<g id="male_gestureAhead" />I'll be anxious to see if you're as strong as she claims. <g id="female_lookaroundScared" priority="high" />Our need is dire.
"Can you give me a status report?"
<g id="male_shrugBrief" />There's little to say. <g id="female_explainS" />We know Artemis is here, the plants mutate rapidly and the beasts grow more savage.
<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />Alchemist Eadred claims some discovery, but I'll be damned if I understand it. <g id="female_explainS" />You should speak with him.
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes, yes, yes! Morgaine mentioned you'd be coming, and that you can help me with this.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I believe I've uncovered a vulnerability in the Angry Earth's campaign - <g id="female_explainS" />a way to eavesdrop on Artemis's intentions.
“That sounds useful.”
<g id="female_explainS" />We've known for centuries the Angry Earth share <g id="male_hivemind" />a sort of hivemind, communicating with one another through roots and spores.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />It seems the strength of Artemis's emotions makes her messages comprehensible.
"You can hear Artemis's orders?"
<g id="female_explainS" />More like... "feel." Touch the roots on the embankment,<g id="male_gestureAhead" /> and you'll understand what I mean.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />I have shared this insight with Morgaine as well. You <g id="male_gestureAhead" />should discuss the implications with her after you experience it for yourself.
The Elysian Wilds are born, my brothers and sisters…
Spread, spread our influence across forest and mountain, until all Aeternum is ours.
Restrain any humans you find and bring them to me. They have a purpose yet.
<g id="male_lookLeftBody" priority="high" />So you've heard the ominous words of the Huntress, have you? <g id="female_lookConcern" />Somehow, she sounds different, knowing she's an Ancient.
<g id="male_dismissRegal" priority="high" />Hmph. No matter, the content of her message is the greater concern.<g id="female_youknowS" /> I trust you agree.
"Why is she capturing humans?"
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I fear discovering the answer to that question will do little to increase our morale, <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />which is already sapping in this place.
Nonetheless, <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />we must learn all we can of Artemis's plans and how we might stop this madness.
Search {POITags} for seeds for Morgaine’s inoculate

Examine the Murmuring Root Nearby
Come on in! We've everything you could need, just try not to make a mess of things.
Welcome to 'The Everlasting Torch'! We're always burning for you. You here to check in? Be my guest… literally!
INTO THE WILDS
Into the Wilds

Morgaine requests that you travel west in search of survivors and Hargest's rangers. Help whoever you can, bring back any survivors, and if possible find a means to investigate the horrors beyond the inner bramble walls.
<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />With these savage beasts and even the plants aligned against us, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />there is no safe place for any in this region.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />I had hoped the settlement to the south would still be standing,<g id="female_disappointed" priority="high" /> but I fear otherwise.
"We should search for survivors."
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes, particularly with this revelation that Artemis may have some twisted intent for them.
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />The rangers have searched fruitlessly so far, but that is no surprise. If you wish to help them,<g id="male_pointsoutthere" /> speak to Captain Hargest.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />We must discern the Huntress's full intentions, <g id="female_lookConcern" />however depressing that may be.
<g id="male_salute2FingersFast" />Ah, the hero of Aeternum! Morgaine predicted you'd come, though I'm skeptical of the claims the sorceress makes with such<g id="litearmor_shrugbrief" />… certainty.
Nonetheless, I welcome any capable combatant. We're <g id="male_spreadarms001" />spread thin as gossamer down here.
"Can you give me a status report?"
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />There's little to say. We know Artemis is here, <g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />the plants mutate rapidly and the beasts grow more savage.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Our scouts face peril whenever they leave camp. Just now,<g id="male_pointsoutthere" /> the last patrol has even failed to report back in.
"I can search for them."
<g id="male_fistpumpLargeRight" />There's some pluck! I'll take it. <g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />We've lost scouts, but an entire patrol… this is worrisome.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />They ranged out by the lake at Forellac, so check there first, <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />and be vigilant - the land itself strains to destroy us.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />If we lose an entire patrol, <g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />we'll have barely enough to defend this place.
Did Hargest send you? <g id="female_cheerFistpump" />It's about time! Something strange is afoot here - <g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />it may be the spores…
<g id="female_explainS" />We all lost our bearings! We spooked a ragged-looking woman by the water, and we went after her... <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />and then I was alone.
"The other scouts disappeared?"
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes, the trees and plants assailed us as we ran, <g id="female_explainS" />and we got separated. I must search for them. But Hargest said survivors were top priority.
"I'll look for the survivor."
<g id="male_nod1" />That makes sense. <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />I think she's hiding out in one of the hovels at the lake.
<g id="female_explainS" />Her eyes were wild, like she may be infected with some strange Angry Earth madness. <g id="female_lookConcern" />I suggest approaching with caution.
<g id="female_clasphandsRequest" />I hope you find the woman. Whether she's gone mad or not, she deserves our help.

<g id="female_blameLong" />You-you can't be here! Oh, I pray you're not real… are you? <g id="female_yourecrazy" priority="high" />Run then! Nothing can save us. Nothing! She will use you to make more of those horrors. Go!

<g id="male_lookaroundWorried" priority="high" />Are you the messenger? You must be looking for one of the others... <g id="male_dazed" priority="high" />but they're not here. <g id="male_lookawayGuilty" priority="high" />No. No, they're... <g id="female_shakeheadNo" />I can't recall.

<g id="male_lookaroundWorried" priority="high" />It's just me now. I wrote it all down, but where? <g id="male_lookdownOhmy" priority="high" />Where are we even? <g id="female_impatient" priority="high" />This is not the town hall!
"I can get you to safety."

<g id="male_lookdownOhmy" />Safety? Safety? <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />It's a little late for that! Besides, I have to stay in the Town Hall. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I'm the constable…
<g id="male_why" />But something happened, didn't it? Yes,<g id="male_agree1" /> it's in my notes. Others must know! <g id="female_beckonUrgent" priority="high" />I can't leave without my notes.
"Alright. I'll find your notes."

<g id="male_dazed" priority="high" />Yes, would you do that… for me? I-I know I must look a mess, <g id="male_lookaroundWorried" priority="high" />but there's a reason.<g id="female_saluteFistchest" /> I have a plan, <g id="female_impatient" priority="high" />I just don't remember it.<g id="female_clasphandsLeanPlead" /> I need those notes!
<g id="female_impatient" priority="high" />Watch out for those... whatever's out there. <g id="female_beckonUrgent" priority="high" />They're not human! Be careful!
<g id="male_pleadHandsclasped" />My notes… I must have them!

For as far back as I can remember, the tower on the mountain has been dark, but last night, we saw its light burst forth into the sky. I went along with Riches to investigate, and what I saw... I cannot describe. The Huntress was there, and another woman, but then she wasn't. After that, we ran back home.

They're closing in. The last few of us are holed up in the tavern... though Gunter is gone. I hope he made it out. The vines crept into our homes at night, and then... the screams. I saw Gladis... crying for help as she was dragged into some kind of pod. There was nothing I could do.

The settlement has fallen! I ran. <g id="male_lookawayGuilty" />I had no choice. We thought we were safe... but then she was there, and everything went mad! I can only hope Kim and Riches were able to get away. Perhaps, if I search... yes.

It was a mistake to go back, to see… what I struggle to even explain. Watcher Linch… it was horrible. There's no hope for her… nor for me, I suppose. I should go, but I don't know where. The lake, perhaps. It's nice this time of year.
[Drawings depict a horrific female visage wreathed in snakes, a giant bull man blowing a horn, and a bird walking on human legs covered in blood.]
<g id="female_covermouthShocked" />Are those… yes, those are my notes! <g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Thank the heavens! This is all I had! <g id="female_nodRelieved" />It's my story, you see?
<g id="male_noway" priority="high" />Wait, don't look, don't even read them, it's a curse! <g id="female_impatient" priority="high" />She could be coming for us even now!
"Come with me. It's safe."
<g id="female_lookaroundConfusedSharp" />Where? Where is it safe? The Town Hall… <g id="female_shakeheadNo" />NO, not there! I can't go back, <g id="female_wavehandPshaw" />anywhere but there!

<g id="male_pleadHandsopen" />If I agree to go with you, at least give me a moment to get my notes in order. <g id="female_headnodding" />Yes, just a moment... and I will be ready. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I promise.
<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />You found her! And she's willing to come back to the camp? Hargest'll be happy, but not if we can't find my fellow scouts.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />I searched north, called out, no answers. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />If they wandered south, that would be bad.
"What's to the south?"

<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />We don't know. Every scout who's ranged down there hasn't returned. <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />It may be a lost cause, or at least, <g id="female_shakeheadNo" />I don't have the heart for it.
<g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />I'm bruised and scratched, and my head is spinning. <g id="female_lookaroundConfusedSharp" />I-I don't know what to do.
"I'll find the other scouts."
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Oh, thank you. <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />There's a rock formation down there, if you climb up you might catch sight of them.

<g id="female_lookConcern" />But I should warn you, there was howling that way unlike any wolf I've heard.<g id="male_dontknow" /> So… be careful,<g id="male_salute2FingersFast" /> and I'll see you back at camp.
Be patient with your charges, my children. They will blossom in time, and yield their lifeforce to merge with our own.
All humanity will be drawn to our embrace, and join us in harmony for the glory to come.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />Whatever's out there, it's not natural. <g id="male_dontknow" />I can tell you that much.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I can't believe it. I didn't even recognize her. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />That woman is Sylvia Oakes, former constable of First Light.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />Whatever she witnessed, it's scrambled her mind something awful. <g id="male_dontknow" />Just talking to her… I need to take some time.
<g id="male_outfitashamed" />You… you're the one who got my notes… you didn't read them, did you? <g id="male_lookdownAshamed" />Trust me, you don't want to.
<g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />It's better I don't remember. I just want to… take a nap. Yes,<g id="male_agree1" /> a nap would be nice.
I cannot believe you found me. Please, save my friends.
Gah! This goop burns terribly. I fear I must leave with haste.
Thank you! So embarassing… nearly taken out by a plant.
I thought I could trust my eyes. Alas, this land is quite deadly.
<g id="female_throwarmsFrustrated" priority="high" />Bah! The survivor's mind is gone beyond recall, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />and there's nothing be done for it.
<g id="female_headnodding" />She saw something, but she can't tell us anything useful. <g id="female_crossarms" />I shall have to delve into her memories and attempt to make sense of them.
"You can do that?"
<g id="male_headNodYes" />It's an enchantment I learned from my brother long ago. It will be fragmented in there, but I am practiced in such things.
<g id="male_gestureAhead" />Stand the other side of her and we'll explore her memories together.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />That was… frightening. Images of terror and evil creatures of legend... <g id="female_thinking" />were they hallucinations? Let us hope.
<g id="male_explain" />Either way, Artemis's intentions clearly go beyond the extermination of humanity. <g id="female_shakeheadNo" />She forges a new natural order.

INTO THE DARKNESS
Into the Darkness

Morgaine once again needs our assistance breaking through into the lowland jungles for Captain Hargest, so that we can investigate the destroyed settlement of First Light. Help Hargest and her rangers make it down safely.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />And what's this I hear about scouts being trapped inside of pods? <g id="female_lookConcern" />Could this be why Artemis seeks captives?
<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />Whatever purpose she plans, it must not be realized. We need<g id="female_smackfist" /> to get to the old settlement as soon as possible.
“I'll work with them."
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes, you do that. I must consult Myrddin's tomes. Minotaurs, gorgons, massive beasts... this is unprecedented.
<g id="male_gestureAhead" />Help these bumbling fools get a foothold to the south, and learn what you can. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />And be quick, for hope's sake.
<g id="male_explain" />If the survivor's memories are to be believed, atrocities beyond imagination are under way in the old settlement. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />We must get there, and with haste!
<g id="female_clasphandsGratitude" />You've brought a measure of health and hope to the camp, <g id="female_lookConcern" />but I fear the roots of this vile catastrophe go much deeper.
<g id="male_explain" />Before you venture forth again, I would speak with you about this rabid frenzy that affects the beasts here.
"Is it caused by the spores?"
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes, and I pray it's reversible, <g id="male_explain" />or Hargest will destroy every beast she can. I've germinated seeds for a vine that will at least repel the creatures.
<g id="female_giveitemFromside" />Here - take these pods and if you head south, plant them. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />That's all I ask.
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Hail, the conquering hero! <g id="female_cheerFistpump" />My returning scouts are singing your praises.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />But no medals just yet, we need to push south, <g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />and we've no more time for Trahern's experiments.
"He gave me these seed pods…"
<g id="male_agree1" />Heh. Be my guest, plant them as you go, <g id="male_headShakeNo" />but we need to push on, especially against these monster gorillas.
<g id="female_crossarms" />Five times, I've sent rangers south to secure a position. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />At this point, I'm going myself.
"I'll go with you."
<g id="male_nodunderstand" />Well, alright then! <g id="male_explain" />We'll split up and battle our way through the gorillas, and you can plant Trahern's pods.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />There's a broken down wagon on a ridge not too far -<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> we meet there and light a signal fire.
<g id="male_fistRaiseLeft" />Feels good to get out and swing my blade. <g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Been sitting on my hands in the camp too long!
<g id="male_lookaroundWorried" priority="high" />Now, where the hell are the rangers I sent to secure this position? They can't all have been captured!
"Let's spread out and search."
<g id="male_nod1" />Alright. The rangers may be incapacitated by these damn spores. Let's hope that's the case, anyways.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Either way, see any plants exuding spores, <g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />hold your breath, and crush them with your boot, then meet at the bottom of the hill.
<The ranger has a blank stare and seems to be intoxicated by the spores nearby.>
Be wary warrior! Unseen beasts stalk these lands.
Thank you. Oh, my head… I must return to the camp.
Those creatures... They were going to eat me if not for you.

These sprig-heads in Dayspring have no idea what fury Albert Riches is about to unleash on them. Huntress thinks she's getting over on us, teaming up with snake-women and bull-men, but when you're all human, you learn to live by your wits, and I'll bet my survivalist soul on being harder, scrappier, and a good bit smarter than a bunch of juiced up weeds! If they're borrowing from mythology, I think I'll remind them what mankind's famous for... we make FIRE.
<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Luck was with us! I found a few rangers dazed by the spores, and I saw you helping one yourself… <g id="female_lookConcern" />I just hope they get back to camp.
<g id="female_leanforwardListenNod" />Poking around this site, seems we might have an ally lurking around these parts.

<g id="male_explain" />This might actually be a good strategic position. We know something's going up at Light's Crown, <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />and I'm betting it's going to be quite a battle.
<g id="male_nodunderstand" />I've sent for reinforcements. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Keep me posted if you learn anything new.

SURVIVALIST'S REVENGE
Survivalist's Revenge

Hargest thinks we should investigate Dayspring Mills on our way to the settlement, and evidence suggests that Albert Riches may be fighting back. Travel into the overgrown village and search for whatever clues you can find.
<g id="male_explain" />Some kind of survivalist named Riches, <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />sounds like he's waging a one-man war against the Angry Earth.
<g id="male_nod1" />My kind of guy. He hasn't been seen for days, so his plans may have gone awry.
"He could probably use some help."
<g id="male_nod1" />Sure enough, and he may have a grip on the situation at the settlement.
<g id="female_nodConsider" />I've been chewing on a plan since we set out on this mission, <g id="male_explain" />a way we might be able to retake the settlement and free any captives.
"Sounds good. What's the plan?"
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />Spirit shrine at the settlement's clearly broken, <g id="male_explain" />but if we can repair it, we can summon rangers right into town.
<g id="female_crossarms" />Now, that's a big IF, and one of us would need to go back to prepare, but I think it's worth a shot.
"You go back, I'll push on."
<g id="male_nod1" />Had a feeling you'd say that… least I got to see a little action, eh? <g id="male_salute2FingersFast" />Alright, I'll head back and get everyone ready.
<g id="male_gestureAhead" />You find this survivalist fellow, infiltrate the settlement, and get that shrine repaired. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Stay strong, friend.
<g id="female_cheerFisthigh" />We've got a foothold, and that's progress! <g id="female_crossarms" />Wouldn't be surprised to get a cheer when I tell everyone back at camp.
<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Woo! About time the cavalry arrived! <g id="male_spreadhands" />Feared I was the last skin and bones left in the territory.

<g id="male_explain" />And with the sprig-heads closing in, I decked this place out with enough boom powder to send <g id="female_gestureUpward" priority="high" />us all sky high! <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I was ready, I tell you!
"You were going to blow yourself up?"
<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />I got a few resurrections left in me. <g id="male_explain" />Besides, it's better than getting thrown into one of those pods!<g id="male_headShakeNo" />
<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />Folks go in, but don’t come out… drains the Azoth right out of them!<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> It's nasty business at the settlement these days.
"Are there any other survivors?"

<g id="female_nodConsider" />Aye, maybe those who fled early-on, but the Huntress is raining terror down from above, <g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />and everyone got pulled into a pod, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />except for yours truly.
<g id="male_outfitproud" />I turned the tavern into a bunker <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />and held out until they forgot about me.
"Can the settlement be retaken?"
<g id="female_chuckle" />Hah! <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />You're serious? Not much to retake, but if you got the guts to try, <g id="female_cheerFistpump" />I say why-the-hell-not!

<g id="female_beckonLarger" />Come to my little hidey-hole in the tavern. <g id="male_explain" />You'll have to chop some weeds on the way, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />but you're clearly the capable sort.

<g id="male_spreadhands" />Welcome to the settlement of Elysian Wilds, <g id="female_shrugShort" />or what's left of it. <g id="female_bowDeep" />Constable Magistrate Riches, at your service... <g id="female_shrugShort" />whatever title you prefer.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" />Now you've seen for yourself what it's like out there. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />It's not pretty.
<g id="male_explain" />Look, mate! I got boom stashed<g id="female_spreadarms" /> ALL OVER this little town. All over Dayspring Mills. <g id="male_nod1" />Aye, small stash in Forellac too.

<g id="female_beckonLarger" />If you're not a mirage, mate, and those sprig-heads are dead… <g id="male_gestureForwardLefthand" />ya mind snipping that wick? <g id="female_lookConcern" />Not my first grand escape, but my hand's still a wee bit shaky.

FIRST LIGHT, LAST STAND
First Light, Last Stand

Albert Riches needs reinforcements! Travel northwest to Tanglesnap Hollows where Taurus disposed a chunk of the spirit shrine, destabilizing its effectiveness. It may be a longshot, but forage for ingredients to repair the shrine and correct its power to allow our allies safe passage.

<g id="male_explain" />Now I got boom stashed all over this town, <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />so we can definitely give the sprig-heads what for, <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />but I'm not sure this'll ever be a town again.
Not unless you got an army of reinforcements you failed to mention.
"Can we restore the spirit shrine?"

<g id="female_nodConsider" />Ah, now there's smart thinking! <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I like it! <g id="male_explain" />The Huntress's pet minotaur smashed the shrine good though,<g id="female_spreadarms" /> sent stone work flying way out!
<g id="female_nodConsider" />But if you can recover the stone, <g id="male_explain" />and mix together a little pitch, you might repair it.
"How do I mix this 'pitch'?"
<g id="female_chuckle" />Ah, now we get creative - <g id="male_explain" />get our ingredients from the sprig-heads and their pets. Resin, filler, fat, that'll do it.
<g id="male_explain" />Mix that, find the shrine-stone northwest of town, and usher your friends in. <g id="female_crossarms" />I'll make preparations here.
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Our champion delivers - as sure as day follows night! <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Some had doubts, <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />but I knew you would pull through.

<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Morgaine won't join us <g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />- she's lost in some old tome, <g id="female_shrugDontcare" />muttering about the gorgon who serves at Artemis's side.
"What about the gorgon?"
<g id="male_explain" />Gorgons of old could turn someone to stone with a look, and the sorceress seeks protection.

<g id="female_explainS" />But the gorgon commands from the rear, and on your order, we have rangers ready to <g id="male_fistpumpRight" />come through and fight for this ground. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Say the word.
"Bring them."

<g id="female_gestureForward01" />Then go and begin the battle whenever you're ready. <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />We'll match the fury of nature with a fury of our own,<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> and restore balance here.
<g id="male_nod1" />Then we must start looking to Light's Crown.
<g id="female_smackfist" />We shall release these poor creatures <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />from their malice. If but for a moment.
<g id="female_salute2finger" />You are a force of nature. <g id="female_gestureForward01" />You should push on ahead.
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I will get things settled here and then begin my investigations into the beast encampment to the east.<g id="female_worry" /> I sense terrible power there.
<g id="female_spreadarms" />You're not a moment too early, friend! Did you hear the roars and howls? <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />The beasts will attack any moment!
<g id="female_chuckle" />And bless my hide if I don't smell a entire hunting pack headed this way! <g id="female_smackfist" />Tell me your friends are coming from the shrine!
"We just need to hold out."
<g id="male_outfitproud" />Then let us stand together against whatever she sends our way, <g id="female_smackfist" />and prove that humanity will not be turned into plant food!
<g id="male_enraged" />Let's decorate this tavern with the innards of the monstrosities who trespass in our town!
<g id="female_order" />We'll cover you from in here! Go!

<g id="female_nodConsider" />I have to admit, things were starting to get a little dark both outside... and inside my head at one point. <g id="male_handheart" />It's been better since you arrived. Much better.
<g id="male_laughCocky" />Well, that was a fight for the ages! I'd say after today, <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />we won't give the leaf lady another inch of this land!
<g id="male_outfitproud" />Huntress thinks nature's on her side, but she forgot about human nature! <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />The good, the bad, <g id="female_smackfist" />and the vengeful!

ABDUCTED ARTIFICER
Abducted Artificer

Survivalist Riches implores us for aid, saving his kidnapped friend Jihoon Kim. Kim was captured by Medusa in the initial invasion, but Riches recently spotted him being dragged east to Saircor, go rescue the Artificer if you can.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />Now to the less pleasant part of this whole deal… <g id="male_hanghead" />my friends and neighbors from this fair town, taken captive.

<g id="male_explain" />We can keep busting people out of pods,<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> but one friend was hauled off for other purposes, <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />perhaps even darker.
"What other purposes?"

<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Not sure, but it didn't sound good. Jihoon Kim - <g id="male_explain" />the town artificer a mechanical genius - Artemis said she had a special project for Kim, and that's all I know.
<g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />That sweaty Minotaur knocked him flat and carried him away.
"I'll go to rescue Artificer Kim."
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Hoping you'd volunteer, <g id="female_leanpointConvince" />of anyone here, you're the only one who could go toe-to-toe with the Bull-man.
<g id="male_explain" />They took Kim east to the Ancient ruins of Saircor - something strange going on there.<g id="female_lookConcern" /> I'd proceed with caution.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />I'm not the most trusting man. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Artificer Kim is the best friend I have. <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />You have to get him out of there.
<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />Whoa! Until you got close, I thought you were charging to attack.
<g id="male_dontknow" />Spore dust or something in my eyes, I can barely see a thing. <g id="female_leanpointConvince" />Are you Covenant, Marauder, or Syndicate?
"Does that matter right now?"
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I guess not, or so everyone's saying. <g id="male_explain" />Archdruid Trahern made our Adjudicator swear to the truce before letting us through the spirit shrine.
<g id="female_nodConsider" />Seems all three factions made a beeline for this island, however.
"Why did everyone come this way?"

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Oh, I don't know... <g id="male_explain" />rumors of Ancient ruins no one's seen, bursting out of the ground? <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Our intentions are good, but the other factions? <g id="male_forgetit" />Forget it.
Beasts gave us all pause, though, <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />so now I'm guarding the road.
"I heard prisoners were taken this way?"
<g id="male_listenforward" />There were? That must've been before I was here, <g id="female_lookConcern" />and they may well have been consumed by these beasts.
<g id="female_order" />You should look for Adjudicator Ramla up ahead though, she might know something more. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Watch your back, friend.
If Archdruid Trahern sent you, tell him I'm honoring my word, observing the truce... as long as everyone else does.
We're making progress and setting up safe camps to the benefit of all.
"I found some of your supplies."
I had thought those supplies lost when our people went missing along the way. It will be good to have them, especially this close to Saircor.
Whatever is going on over there is unpleasant, to say the least.
"Any sign of the Minotaur?"
Minotaur, no, thankfully. Prisoners... maybe. There's someone in the ruins in an awful lot of pain.
He's in deep though. If you're staging a rescue, you're going alone. We have our hands full up here.

Please help! They haven't noticed me writing yet. I don't know why they are taking me. But they also took some of my tools, so they must need me to fix… or make something. I'll try to drop notes as I discover more.
They took my quill but I made another. I don't have much time, I overheard mention of taking me to Medusa for instructions, but that can't be right, can it? I'll write more when I can.
This is my last piece of paper. I've come to realize we're not headed to Saircor. If we were, we would have turned by now. Where are they taking me? And why?
<g id="male_salute2Fingers" />Oh thank you! I should have never gotten so close to the ruins, <g id="male_explain" />but I just had to study the lights! Have you ever seen such contraptions before?
"Have you seen an Artificer Kim?"
<g id="male_dontknow" />No, but I'm not the only prisoner here. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Good luck finding him, and thanks for the help!
<g id="male_explain" />We were tracking the Hercyne when we fell into their trap. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />I had to know more about how they were made.
"Have you seen an Artificer Kim?"

<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />No, we followed him here but were captured before we found where they're holding him. <g id="male_lookaroundWorried" />I'd help you look, but I need to tell Trahern what we saw.
I swear, I should have stayed back north, <g id="male_forgetit" />and never come to this place.
<g id="female_startledHandmouth" />How did you make it through? There were so many of them… <g id="female_lookConcern" />too many for Sebastien and I to fight through.
"Have you seen an Artificer Kim?"
<g id="female_nodConsider" />Yes, they're holding him in the central area. <g id="female_explainS" />He's heavily guarded because he tried to escape.
<g id="male_fistpumpRight" />Fates align! Break these bars and get me out of here!
<g id="female_lookDownGuilty" />Even when I heard the sounds of battle, I hardly believed it possible. <g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />I have been down here more days than I can count.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />The things I witnessed… <g id="male_guiltyLookside" >the things I helped <g id="female_clasphandsLeanPlead" />create… tell me, are we too late? Have they taken over?
"Has who taken over?"
<g id="male_enraged" />The Hercyne… horrific hybrid abominations made of man, plant, and beast. <g id="female_lookDownGuilty" />They made me do it.
<g id="female_lookDownGuilty" />The gorgon, Medusa, she forced me, but if I had known what that machine did, I <g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />would've refused, whatever suffering they imposed on me.

<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Not sure I'm cut out for whatever Aeternum has in store for us next.
ESCAPING SAIRCOR
Escaping The Ruins

Jihoon Kim believes Medusa and Artemis stole an item of importance and stashed it at Portico Tideswallow. If the item is recovered, it may convince the Minotaur there is something sinister going on with Artemis and the Beast Lords.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />It wasn't here - it was up on the mountain, where they're channeling energy from the tower, and taking the captives in their pods…
<g id="female_lookDownGuilty" />The screams, the roars… and the Hercyne that emerge,<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> I cannot think about it.
"They're turning them into Hercyne?"
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes, please don't ask for any more details. I worked on the machine for weeks, <g id="female_lookDownGuilty" />and then I saw… only the beginning.
<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />Medusa brought me back down to these ruins,<g id="male_guiltyLookdown" /> leaving the Minotaur as my jailer.
"Where is the Minotaur now?"
<g id="female_shrugShort" />He left.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> He is not like Artemis and Medusa. He does not relish this, and he spoke to me, with compassion.
<g id="male_explain" />Upon my return, I told him what I saw, and he seemed stricken. <g id="female_lookConcern" />He said he needed time to think, and he left.
"I'd like to speak to him."
<g id="female_lookConcern" />Be wary if you do for his temper is short, and his loyalty is to the Beast Lords. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I can help you with him.

<g id="male_explain" /> I overheard Medusa mention an item that was taken from the Beast Lords and kept nearby. <g id="female_beckon" priority="high" />If you bring it to the Minotaur, <g id="female_shrugShort" />perhaps he’ll listen.
"Where can I find this item?"
<g id="male_shrugBrief" />Somewhere secure. <g id="female_explainS" />There was another captive, a Syndicate scholar named Josephine. She might’ve escaped.
<g id="male_beckonUrgent" /> Find Josephine. If anyone understand the Ancient wards in these ruins, it would be her.
<g id="male_hopeless" />I had given up hope of ever seeing a human face again. <g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />I will never forget what I have endured.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Thanks again for helping me back there, <g id="female_explainS" />sometimes I let my curiosity get the better of me, which is probably why I joined the Syndicate.
<g id="male_explain" />I'm here studying how the Ancients powered this place. Have you seen their wiring schematics? <g id="male_fistpumpLargeRight" />They're wild!
"You're who I need to talk to."
<g id="male_bowDeepHandsfolded" />I'll gladly answer any questions you have about Ancient wiring, or anything really. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I owe you after Tempestas Custodia.
"I'm looking for something."
<g id="female_explainS" />Any locks in this place are based on weird energy. <g id="female_order" />You'll need to fix and power up the pylons in order to get access to it.
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I'll go and rewire sections of the ruins while you reconstruct the pylons.
All fixed? <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Us too. With the pylons repaired, <g id="female_explainS" />our expert in Ancient machinery can attempt to gain control of the defenses.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />He’s a Marauder, so make sure his soldiers aren’t breaking the machines. <g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />We can’t afford any more repairs.
"You're not the expert?"

<g id="female_waverightNoway" />Not yet! I'm hoping to learn from the best and one day take that title! <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Good luck, and I hope what I found will help end the hostilities here.
<g id="male_salute2FingersFast" />Well done. You are indeed a formidable warrior, <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />and I am deeply in your debt for my liberation.
<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />It seems Aeternum is not yet overrun with Hercyne,<g id="female_spreadarms" /> and there is yet hope.

MAZE AND THE MINOTAUR
Maze and the Minotaur

Kim asks that we boldly brave the Labyrinth of the minotaur Taurus, Northeast of the Ancient ruins, so that we may speak to him. Survive the deadly challenges within, and parley with the beastman if you can.
<g id="female_explainS" />I overheard much conversation between Artemis and Medusa while I worked.
<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />Their hatred for humanity knows no bounds, and indeed, <g id="female_lookConcern" />they seem to relish whatever suffering they can impose up on their captives.
"We have to stop them somehow."
<g id="male_think" />These Beast Lords with whom Artemis has forged an alliance would seem to be the final part of her plan.
<g id="male_explain" />Whatever power they bring to her cause is primal, and in exchange she promises the beasts a share in her new order.
"Who are the Beast Lords?"
<g id="female_explainS" />The Beast Lords are even older than the Ancients, perhaps as old as the Earth itself, <g id="female_nodConsider" />and they have elemental powers.
<g id="male_explain" />They are the original progenitors of the beasts we see today, and they have come to negotiate on the beasts' behalf.
"Do they know about the Hercyne?"
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" />Hm. Perhaps not, and perhaps this is what caused concern for the Minotaur. <g id="female_nodConsider" />Yes, you should seek him out.
<g id="male_patience" />I believe he has taken the fortress to the northeast as his home. <g id="female_clasphandsLeanPlead" />Approach him there, but be cautious!

<g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />I… am so sorry… for my hand in aiding them with that Ancient device. <g id="male_outfitashamed" />I didn't know the purpose they intended until it was too late. It must be destroyed.
Hail, warrior! You are brave like the heroes of old. And smart enough to navigate my labyrinth, so I salute you.
If you come seeking battle, then let us battle, and allow fate to decide who is more deserving of victory.
"I come to talk, not to fight."
Mmm. Very well, but know this: I have no patience for dishonesty, and I am no fool. Speak plainly and truthfully, or battle we will.
I am Taurus, the Wild, the Bull, the Minotaur of Crete, and I have no love for mankind.
"You want to destroy humanity."
I've known the Huntress for centuries beyond count and have fought by her side. But I do not fight in this war.
I serve as emissary to the Beast Lords, to whom I've sworn eternal allegiance. Strike my drum, and I will tell you more.
So you see, I swear no allegiance to the Huntress, and I do not war with humanity, unless provoked.
I have also recently learned of… strange rituals the gorgon Medusa stages in her guarded glade. Very strange.
"She combines beasts and humans."
Mmm. This I still find hard to believe. Why would the Huntress engage in such atrocities? She is enraged, but... I do not know.
I admit my instincts tell me something is amiss. The Beast Lords are not themselves.
There are yet more Lords to attend to. Their plans will not wait for you. Go.
<g id="female_clasphandsLeanPlead" />Whatever happens, you must destroy that machine on the mountain. <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />Medusa's experiments cannot continue.

LORD OF THE PRIDE
Lord of the Pride

To forge an alliance with the Beast Lords we will first need to prove ourselves to them. Taurus suggests that we begin with the Lion Lord Shirzad to the north in Gurhaowl's Pride. Complete his challenge and gain an audience.
I am the one who summoned the Beast Lords, and it was on my word that they agreed to bargain with the Huntress.
If I have misled them, I am ashamed; and if they succumb to her influence, the danger is great.
"What would happen?"
The Beast Lords are primal powers, far beyond anything you or I can imagine. If they war, they will win.
Of equal concern, the Tear of Gaea, a relic of this island's creation safekept for millennia, but now part of the Huntress's bargain.
“She can’t get the Tear of Gaea."
Then you must approach the Beast Lords and strike your own bargain, human. I cannot do so on your behalf, and I need to investigate these claims.
Approach the Lion Lord, Shirzad, in his Pride to the north. Tell him you have my blessing.
Shirzad will grant you audience, but be wary on approach. His Pride will not tolerate trespassers.
Move swiftly, cub, lest my children use your bones to sharpen their fangs.
Shirzad smells Taurus upon you, yet you are not dead. Curious. What could compel you to so brazenly stand before the Lord of Lions?
“He gave me his blessing to come."
<Roars!> Presumptuous! What could we possibly speak about?
"I hope to strike a new bargain."
Hah, why would the Beast Lords strike a bargain with humanity? You are but evolved amoeba adrift in the cosmos.
Prove to Shirzad you are worthy. Survive my den in the rocks below. Then shall you have your audience.
You stood your ground with honor and fought with skill. Shirzad shall grant you an audience.
It will be difficult to compete with the Huntress's bargain, but we will hear your offer.
Speak with Shirzad the Lion Lord

THE PROVING GROUNDS
The Proving Grounds

Shirzad has listened to our plea and is willing to entertain our propositions for now. Travel west to Kurok's Anchorage and speak with the Gorilla Lord Kurok. Deliver Shirzad's message and gain an audience with the Lord.
You know Artemis and her tribe as Ancients, but we were here aeons before, and we know them as invaders.
But she builds a great army and promises us dominion over great swaths of Earth. Why would we refuse?
"She uses beasts as fodder."
… If the Huntress seeks to trick us in this alliance, you will need no bargain, human. We will seek our own vengeance.
But you present no evidence to support the boldness of your accusation.
"Taurus is investigating."
Then Shirzad will await his testament. Meanwhile, you must entreat with the other Beast Lords.
Mahantaram indulges an animal fury of late, so approach Kurok, Gorilla Lord, and tell him you seek to address the Tribunal.
Be wary of Mahantaram; he has not been himself.
I would crush you, but the howls of war have yet to sound and my tribe likes the sport.
What business does a little hairless human have with the mighty Lord Kurok?
I sense the energies of both Taurus and Shirzad upon you, but I know you have not bested them, so why do you travel this land, consorting with beasts?
"I seek to address the Tribunal."
And Shirzad has agreed to convene one on your behalf? Grr. The Lion Lord presumes much of me!
I must see your strength, human. Do you deem yourself a champion of your tribe?
“Enough to accept your challenge.”
Very well. My brothers are restless in this land and clamor to attack. Since you ask us to delay, they will want sport.
Fight my patriarchs, human. If you live, which I doubt, return to me.
You are… no normal human. That is sure. You fought with great strength, and while you fought, I communed with Shirzad.
Your claims against the Huntress concern me gravely, all the more because Mahantaram has spent much time with her.

RAGE OF THE MAMMOTH
Rage of the Mammoth

Kurok has accepted our bid of peace for now, and is willing to reconvene with Shirzad over their fate on Aeternum. He now worries for his kin Mahantaram, the final Lord. Head east to the Trampled Lands, and face the mammoth.
The Mammoth Lord is oldest amongst us, and anger smolders in his heart for what became of his kind.
He is also the guardian of the Tear of Gaea, so his participation in the Tribunal is of highest importance.
"I will entreat with him."
Go quickly, for even as we speak, I stretch out to commune with him, and Mahantaram does not respond.
The Mammoths have begun to rampage, and I fear something transpires beyond our awareness.
"Where is the Tear of Gaea?"
Only Mahantaram has the power to summon it from its vault. Let us hope he has not already done so.
If Artemis truly seeks to betray us in this bargain, and if she acquires the Tear of Gaea, then even the Beast Lords cannot stand against her.
I sense strange changes within Mahantaram's soul, and I hear the thunder of his tribe resounding in the earth.
I will you crush you human, leaving but the stain of your soul!
Earth belongs to us now, humanity has no place!
Humankind hunted our tribe to near extinction. Now it's our turn!
Avenge me… brothers…
Human! I felt your battle, and the unseating of Manhantaram’s soul… shifted to the caverns south of here.
Do you mean to tell Shirzad that YOU have bested a Beast Lord?
"He fell under her influence."
Then we have truly been betrayed by Artemis and undone by these alien spores that clog the air.
And this means our primal oath is broken, and the Huntress has now in her possession the Tear of Gaea.
"What does that mean?"
It is more dire than you can imagine. The Tear of Gaea harbors the power to recreate this island and the world beyond.
If Artemis achieves Ascension, then no power can stop her.
"Then we need to hurry!"
You need to hurry, human. My duty is to the Tribunal, and I must convene with Kurok over Mahantaram’s fate.
If Fate opposes the Huntress's bid for Ascension, then surely, you are its champion. Go and lead your tribe to victory.
Mmm. Your words proved true, and will now echo across the ages in legend.
It was the gorgon, Medusa, who poisoned Mahantaram's spirit, and I go now to crush the snake. Will you fight at my side, human?
"I will join you in battle."
Rally your people first, for the beasts are not with us, and we need every soul we can muster. Then join me to attack Medusa's vile den.
Do not delay, for my axe thirsts to cleave the gorgon's skull, and I have never been one for patience.
She will face my boundless rage!
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Soulwarden! How long has it been? Much has transpired since you left, and the magic in this land swirls into a maelstrom.
Artemis has begun some ritual at the Tower. Ready or not, <g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />the time to fight is here.
“She has the Tear of Gaea.”

<g id="female_covermouthShocked" />… The Tear of Gaea? THE Tear of Gaea? <g id="female_lookConcern" />It is real? It is in the hands of our enemy? Dear gods, if any defy my knowledge, I pray this is somehow untrue!
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />What FOOL allowed the relic of creation to fall into the Huntress's hands? Bah!
Our brother… we shall not let him fall to this affliction.

GARDEN OF THE GORGON
Garden of the Gorgon

Morgaine entreats us to retrieve the Tear of Gaea at all costs, but first we must defeat Medusa. Taurus already makes his way to her vile gardens south west of the ranger camp. Slay the Gorgon and drive her from these lands.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />As if that were not enough, legions of these abominable Hercyne block the passage up the mountain, and the gorgon feeds their numbers.
<g id="female_smackfist" />We must destroy the snake-woman lest she come behind to strike us at the heel.
"The Minotaur and I will defeat her."
<g id="female_explainS" />Then you will need protection from her gaze unless you want to be turned to stone! And you are fortunate to have a friend like Morgaine.
<g id="female_giveitem" />This tincture will protect you and cure your bull-headed friend if he has acted in blind aggression.
"What will you do?"

<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I will collect the Archdruid, for I've realized he does have some uses,<g id="female_shrugShort" /> and Captain Hargest and her rangers, and we will join you when we can.
<g id="male_beckonUrgent" />Go on then, there is no time to waste, Soulwarden!
<g id="female_worry" />I can only hope that Trahern and I have the magic and knowledge you will need to stop what Artemis has begun.
Your wards will not save you!
I will immortalize your beauty!
The Ancient Gods will rise again!
I will… never stop…
I was a fool… blinded by rage. I allowed myself to fall victim to the vile gorgon's gaze and nearly lost all. Thank you, human. I am in eternal debt.
"Now we fight Artemis."
You have my support, but you will not have my axe. I shall not raise it against one who once fought with honor at my side.
I will remain here and ensure the gorgon and her vile creations are kept at bay.
We will meet again, friend. I will not allow my debt to you to go unpaid.
I do not revel in the suffering of others, <g id="female_nodRelieved" />but the cries of Medusa were like a fresh wind of hope.
We must now <g id="female_smackfist" />destroy the foul enclave where crimes against nature continue even now.
"We stop the creation of Hercyne."
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes. Though scores of the monstrosities already roam these lands, we must <g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />ensure Medusa's revolting practices are put to an end.
With the gorgon defeated, <g id="female_smackfist" />the time to strike is now.

ARCANA ALIGNED
Arcana Aligned

Trahern and Morgaine believe they may have devised a means of capturing Artemis and securing the Tear. Meet Morgaine up the road in the high mountains of what is now Scalefang Enclave to see what magic she has in mind.
<g id="male_explain" />The sorceress claims there may also be a way to harness the energies channeled here to bolster our chances against Artemis.
<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />Morgaine's magical theories sound far-fetched to me, but my purpose and my part are clear enough.
"Morgaine knows what she's doing."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />I hope so. We can only sow the seeds of possibility; nature must determine whether we harvest good fortune.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />Go and seek Morgaine within the enclave. If you clear the way, I will join you shortly to do my part.
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Go swift and stay strong. We will need your abilities in the battle to come. Defeating Artemis will take great effort.
<g id="female_bowHead" />Ah, there you are, Soulwarden. As you can see, I warded this area, quite effectively, I might add.
<g id="female_explainS" />We will use this rune circle to siphon the energies here and bolster the strength of your Azoth Staff.
“Why thank you, Morgaine.”
<g id="male_shakehead" />Don't thank me yet. What will arrive is going to be much worse.
<g id="female_explainS" />You need to protect my barrier while I focus on infusing your staff. Place it in the light when you’re ready. It will attract attention.
<g id="female_clasphandsConvince" />Please, let us focus on the task at hand.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Well done. What we have achieved here by siphoning these Ancient energies is very similar to what Myrddin did to first empower his Staff of Wizardry.
<g id="female_crossarms" />But this still falls woefully short of what is needed to battle an Ancient.

ONE WITH NATURE
One With Nature

Morgaine directs us upward to the bloom above. With our Azoth Staff now empowered by the arcane energies channeled from Elafry Pyrgo we have but one more component to secure. Fight with Trahern, claim it, and finish the spell.
Not only is Artemis an Ancient, but if she also draws on the power of the Tear of Gaea,<g id="male_hopeless" /> I fear this may be hopeless.
The one chance we have is to turn her ambition into a vulnerability, <g id="female_smackfist" />and that is what we prepare for.
"So the staff will be the key."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Precisely. Unlike the Archdruid, <g id="female_suppresslaugh" />your skills in comprehension are intact. Trahern does have a role to play however.
<g id="female_explainS" />Artemis twists the flora of First Light with a transformative lifeforce, and the druid can harness this.
"Then it's fortunate we have him."
<g id="male_chuckle" />Heh. You are ever the generous one, but it's true, we cannot accomplish this without him.

<g id="female_explainS" />He will need your assistance. Of that, I am certain. <g id="male_convince01" />Find him on the Bloom above and do whatever it takes. I will meet you at the approach to Light's Crown.
<g id="female_crossarms" />Do not concern yourself. I am more than capable of battling my way safely to the tower.
I had hoped to finish this task more quickly. <g id="female_disappointed" />Unfortunately, I was forced to hide myself away.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />It appears our recent actions have greatly antagonized the local flora and fauna. <g id="male_dontknowS" />Artemis throws everything at us now.
"What is it that we need to do?"
<g id="male_explain" />What we seek is nearby, a seed from a bloom that originated in the initial blast of Artemis’s transformational ritual. As you can see by the area, much power was focused here.
<g id="female_explainS" />Those seeds clustered atop the bloom appear quite potent.
“We should go with potent.”
<g id="male_headNodYes" />I agree. I will try to prevent you from being flanked from behind.

<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" />The beasts that ambushed me earlier were more of those abominations. <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />Prepare for a fierce battle now that Artemis is aware of our presence.
<g id="male_salute2Fingers" />Well done! Yes, <g id="female_headnodding" />this is a beautiful seed, brimming with a powerful lifeforce.
I can extract this energy as Morgaine has requested, but the <g id="female_gestureForward01" />rest will be up to you and her.
"We meet her at Light's Crown."
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes. Let us hope Captain Hargest and her rangers have cleared the way, and that Morgaine has made preparations.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />I sense a pressure quivering in the trees like the anticipation of something terrible. We should hurry.
<g id="male_crossarmsNo" />Worry not, I will meet you at the rally point. I happen to know<g id="female_explainS" /> an old and powerful enchantment that will let me make it there swiftly.
<g id="male_chuckle" />Heh. It turns out the Archdruid can move rather quickly when he senses a threat to his beloved trees.
<g id="female_explainS" />He is prepared even now to infuse your staff with the lifeforce of the seed you acquired. <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />Let us hope that is enough.
"How will this work against her?"
<g id="male_explain" />Artemis cannot be destroyed, so our only hope is that your imbued staff will be capable of imprisoning her.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />But there is no time. Follow Trahern's instruction… this will work, <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />trust me. It had sure better.
The <g id="female_explainS" />Tear of Gaea contains the legacy of great natural power, and from this seed's lifeforce, your staff will be attuned to it.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />All things converge upon this moment. Are you ready to infuse your staff and face the Ancient?
"Ready as always. Let's do this."
<g id="male_explain" />Place your staff over the circle when you are ready and we will finish the final enchantment.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />I hope the sorceress's plan is sound, and you have the prowess to carry it out. The hope of the druids goes with you. Be strong.
This is my last warning to you, human. Come no further.
Dare to interrupt my efforts and your suffering will be spoken of in legend.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />This goes beyond anything Myrddin ever attempted. <g id="male_nodProud" />I am proud to have assisted you.
<g id="male_patience" />The staff is but an implement, however. <g id="female_order" />You will need to weaken Artemis greatly to have any chance of unleashing the staff's new potential.
Exit and Find Glendyn Trahern

THE END OF NEW EDEN
The End of New Eden

Morgaine puts forth her final plea - capture Artemis and secure the Tear of Gaea from her grasp. With your allies at your back, ascend Elafry Pyrgo and battle the Ancient Artemis for the fate of the region, Aeternum, and the World.
<g id="female_shakeheadNo" />I have no inspiring words with which to send you off, young one.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />We must prevent Artemis's ascension, or humanity will surely be destroyed.<g id="female_clasphandsConvince" /> Do whatever you must to stop her.
"What do I do with the Tear?"
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />Heh. That is an excellent question, and I will need to think on it, <g id="female_beckon" priority="high" />but it should not delay us now.
<g id="female_explainS" />Captain Hargest will harry her forces from the ground. Trahern and I will do what we can to slow the ritual. <g id="female_order" />Go.
Even if we fail, Soulwarden, <g id="female_salute2finger" />I am proud of what we have accomplished together…<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" /> in scholarly terms, at least.
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />You have my gratitude for all that you have done here. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I can feel the Azoth flowing through the vines.
Whatever power I can harness, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I shall channel to support you.

<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />You’ve fought through fields of beasts and deadly plants, what’s one more strand of wheat? <g id="female_cheerFistpump" /> Come back in one piece, and human.
Fitting that you are here to witness my Ascension.
The age of humanity comes to an end.
Your evolution will be a new beginning!
You cannot stand against the power of an Ancient!
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have done what even Myrddin could not. It seems every time, <g id="female_salute2finger" />you prove to have new strength that wells up from some unseen source.
<g id="male_lookaroundSmall" />But there is the matter of the<g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" /> Tear of Gaea… we must act quickly.
"What do we do with it?"
<g id="female_lookConcern" />This artifact is too powerful for an Ancient and certainly beyond anything mortal minds can even grasp.
<g id="female_order" />Get it and bring it to me quickly. We must ensure these incompetent druids don't walk away with it.

<g id="male_explain" />This crystal contains the essence of a powerful Ancient. One with a great legacy, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />who sacrificed herself long ago to form the fundamental magic of Aeternum.
<g id="female_lookConcern" />With it, Artemis would have rewritten humanity's story.
"Return it to the Beast Lords?"
<g id="female_shakeheadNo" />Not while this savagery has a grip on them; <g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />they simply cannot be trusted with such power.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />No, I will take it to a place long lost to most, <g id="male_spreadhands" />where it can be safely hidden.
"Are you going to tell me where?"
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />No, it's better I don't. Even your mind could be twisted by such temptation.
<g id="female_explainS" />There are mysteries still yet to unfold, and many beings who would use this for dark purposes. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />Be on your guard. We will meet again.
You have no idea what you’ve wrought. My vessel is fit to wield such power as the Tear of Gaea, not yours.
In fear and pride, you humans grasp beyond your reach. You would be wise to entrust the artifact to me.
“You have no authority to choose.”
Enjoy your temporary victory. But know that you've doomed us all. And humanity will face the coming darkness more alone than ever.
Come, step closer, and I will give you a glimpse of your fate.

<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Congratulations on your victory. The people of Aeternum will hear of the great deeds you've accomplished. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />And perhaps one day, the wider world.
<g id="female_clasphandsConvince" />Please, go speak with everyone, they will be eager.
These events have given me a great deal to consider, human, especially my long-held distrust for your kind. Ha!
You are a great and honorable warrior, and you are my friend. I owe you a great debt. Fate will bring us together again.

<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />This is a fitting land for me and my people, I vow to guard Artemis's prison with my life. <g id="female_salute2finger" />My rangers won't be forgetting you any time soon. Nor will I.
<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />Though, maybe visit sometime, yes?

<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />We have you to thank for all of this. Not only have you defeated Artemis and ended the invasion, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />you have unwound the consequences of my mistakes.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I will stay here, and do what I can to aid in the restoration efforts.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Seeing Kim lightens my heart. Thank you for fulfilling my last request, and thank you for saving us all at the end.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />I will return to the settlement, and try to begin rebuilding. <g id="female_lookConcern" />I sense a darkness that we must be prepared for.
<g id="female_nodRelieved" />We have averted the ascension of an Ancient, and yet there remains more to do. <g id="female_worry" />I fear what could befall the Beast Lords following their affliction.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />You should consider returning to the region, they may need further assistance.

SECRETS OF THE SPORES
Secret of the Spores

Master Alchemist Eadred has made a revolutionary discovery critical to the invasion. Investigate the strange spores blooming in the region and learn how you can use them to your advantage.\n(Requires: Harvesting 100)
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />It’s as if the fungi in this region have a mind of their own. <g id="male_patience" />They display strange behavior patterns not yet documented in any of my tomes.

<g id="male_righthandNodeal" />Morgaine's concoction may keep us alive for now, but what does it matter if the lethal blooms devise new ways to do us harm? <g id="male_lookaroundWorried" priority="high" />Will she still be around to save us?
This dilemma requires the attentions <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />of a master alchemist.
"I suppose you have an answer."

<g id="male_explain" />I believe I have devised a method to render the toxic effects beneficial to us. <g id="male_gestureDownRight" priority="high" />It requires ingredients gathered from the plants themselves.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I’ll prepare a special flask while you gather the spore caps. They can be found<g id="female_gestureLeft" /> in abundance west of the camp.
<g id="male_compliment" />Those caps will do nicely! <g id="female_giveitemFromside" />Now, mix the ingredients and pour it into this flask.
<g id="male_explain" />It’s made from a rare material called Sandstone. <g id="female_smackfist" />It should be strong enough to contain the mixture without combusting.
"You mentioned benefits."
<g id="male_gestureAhead" />Try it out for yourself.
<g id="male_explain" />If your body accepts the elixir, not only will you be rendered temporarily immune to the bloom’s toxins, they should also strengthen your senses.
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />It seems everything in this land wants to kill us. <g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />I suppose that shouldn't be so surprising.
<g id="female_covermouthShocked" />Look at that, you’re glowing... <g id="male_wavehandPshaw" />I jest, of course. Remember to keep your flask in tip top shape.
<g id="male_explain" />More Sandstone should enhance it and improve the elixir's capabilities. <g id="female_headnodding" />You’ll need all the help you can get out here.
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />So many new species to record. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I should have brought my apprentice along to do the bookkeeping.
<g id="female_nodConsider" />Then again… it always was so much trouble, keeping him away from the specimens.
Travel to Mosswater Bend to collect spore samples\n(Requires: Harvesting 100)

ENDANGERED BY ARTEMIS
Endangered by Artemis

The Druid Keira implores you to aid the wildlife native to the region. The cries of animals call out from the depths of the jungle, and she feels their fear. Do what you can to keep them from becoming food for some new monstrosity.
The rampant growth of this strange vegetation jeopardizes this fragile ecosystem.
I've seen animals fall prey to prodigious plantlife. Some spew suspicious fumes while others constrict and consume!
"Can they be saved?"
If we're quick about it. I have a special connection to the wild things. Their cries… they’re coming from the south.
Free our animal friends and purge any fiendish flora that's disturbed the natural order.
We don’t know what other horrors were spawned by the transformation of this land. Be cautious.
All is calm now. The animals sing with gratitude for their freedom. Thank you for giving them a second chance.
Aeternum is filled with many creatures that yearn to speak with us. If only we would listen...

A BEAST NO MORE
A Beast No More
Sebastian Vachon is pursuing a dangerous beast and needs your help finding it so he can study its origins. Follow its tracks through the region, defeat it, and bring its cerebrum back to the Druid.
This poor creature suffered a gruesome fate. It strayed too far from its kind, and fell prey to a monster that roams this vicinity.
I have peered into its eyes. It wasn’t a creature born from nature.
"Do you know what it is?"
I can find out. If you wish to help, slay the beast and bring me its brain. With that, I can divine the answer.
"I'll get it for you."
Excellent. It appears to have wandered off toward the mining town. The trail of fresh elk remains should guide you.
I must return to camp and inform the others of this situation. Meet me there when you have the brain.
Some rangers claim to have encountered a creature such as this near the overgrown barrier deep within the mining town.
What we have discovered is deeply disturbing. I must consult with Trahern, there is still much to learn here.
You have the brain? Let me examine it…
Strange… it almost seems like two different beings. One is a stag, but the other… feels strangely familiar? It can’t be. I must inform the archdruid!
It seems the horrific fiend was created by some twisted magic. I fear we haven't seen the last of its kind.

If you are reading this, I am holding Elysian Wilds however I can against the invasion. I know you'll make it soon, I can feel it.
If you've found these plans it means I wasn't able to finish my work. Please, comp--

The plant-men made a home of Dayspring. Dragged townsfolk there when it started… into the pods.

A FRIEND IN NEED
A Friend in Need

Another potential survivor, James Oxen, appears to have dropped a check-list of supplies. There is a crude drawing of a cave on the back. Collect the supplies, find the cave, and protect the survivors.

<g id="male_apologize" />Sorry, matey! Nothing to spare. I did not have the time to consider visitors during my spirited relocation. <g id="male_spreadhands" />All I can offer you is pleasant company!
"To whomever it may concern: I, Captain James Oxen, am in terrible danger. While this may be difficult to believe, I swear it is the truth."
"It is of utmost importance that I be rescued forthwith, lest my plans never come to fruition…"
"Seems Captain James is in trouble."
It's an extremely verbose note. The handwriting becomes increasingly hurried, ending in the bloodstained signature of a "Captain James Oxen."
On the back is a list of supplies, and a crude map to a cave southwest of here.
It's an extremely verbose note. The handwriting becomes increasingly hurried, ending in the bloodstained signature of a "Captain James Oxen."
On the back is a list of supplies, and a crude map to a cave southwest of here.
<g id="female_notsure" />I'm not seeing things? I thought I'd die here on this God-forsaken island. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />You have my eternal thanks, mate!
<g id="female_smackfist" />I'm getting off this rock and damn the consequences. If you've<g id="male_gestureForwardRighthand" /> a mind to brave the Stormwall, you're always welcome in my crew.
"We've secured the tavern."
<g id="male_wipetear" />Are you sent from on high? I will meet you there, fast as a whistle. <g id="male_laughBig" />There's nothing that steadies an old sailor's legs like the promise of grog.

<g id="female_theseidiots" />I bet those fools who gave me the boot would regret it if they were still alive! <g id="male_spreadarms001" />I could be the governor, couldn't I?

PLAGUE FOR ALL FACTIONS
Plague for All Factions
Ramla and her crew have come down with a mysterious illness. Something dangerous has awoken in these ruins and someone tough will be needed to investigate. See if you can solve the mystery.
The Ancient Guardians are nothing new. I run into them a lot working in ruins like this.
There are monsters I've never seen before west of the bridge we're on. Watch yourself out there.
My expedition team fell ill after scouting these ruins. The Syndicate won't move until the "curse" is investigated and the Marauders won't risk sending soldiers here.
We're stuck tending to the ill. Do you have the courage to investigate?
"This island continues to surprise."
I would prefer the surprises to stop. The symptoms are nothing particularly unique, but no treatments are working.
I know you're capable of facing whatever's out there. Finding the source could save my team.
The Syndicate are held up here instead of setting up power for the Marauders.
The whole project could fall apart if we don't find an answer to this blasted plague.
An alchemist told us our "curse" was some Ancient defense mechanism, but I dismissed the idea until the sickness faded.
Now I owe the Syndicate up north an apology.
The collaboration in Saircor is not unprecedented. No one has the manpower or the knowledge to tackle this mission alone.
The factions moving as a unified entity is always a sight to behold.
This place is amazing! I can hardly believe we get to explore an environment so rich in lore. Searching for missions, or equipment perhaps?
Credit where it's due- I think we've learned something from the Syndicate about caution. We'll be much less eager about seizing potential artifacts from now on.
You're looking for Kieven. If I need aid knocking some Ancient Guardian skulls, I'll call for you.

Defective Defenses

Josephine and her Syndicate specialists were ambushed when they set off some form of automated defense system within Tideswallow. Now they need someone to deal with the Ancient Guardians and finish the repairs.

<g id="female_beckon" priority="high" />You can move along. Nothing to see here. <g id="male_quidproquo" />The Covenant bogged down the work to the south. <g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />Now we don't have power.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />The group up north needs us to finish here if they'll have any chance of affecting those defenses.
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />Leave it to the Covenant to unleash a plague. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Can't say I'm surprised with how they touch everything.
<g id="female_explainS" />Awakened loads of Ancient Guardians - <g id="male_spreadarms001" />wrecked our gear! <g id="male_headShakeNo" />No pylons, no control of defenses.

<g id="female_headnodding" />Got a knack for this do you? <g id="female_explainS" />If you gather up enough Ancient scraps, maybe you can fix the pylons. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Then you may need some Ancient tomes, for setting the runes.
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />We're busy trying to keep what we have safe.
<g id="female_explainS" />I don't mind waiting, but I can't say the same for the Marauders.
<g id="female_headnodding" />All fixed? Us too. <g id="male_explain" />With the pylons repaired, our expert in Ancient machinery can attempt to gain control of the defenses.

<g id="female_fingerwagNo" /> Do you know how long I've been working under the cover of night or some cramped workshop? <g id="male_spreadarms001" />I'm enjoying the sun while I can.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Are you here looking for missions or equipment?
<g id="female_taptemple" />Find any Ancient traps lately? If you see anything, <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />we'd appreciate a heads up.
