FACTIONS UNITED
Factions United

The flow of power has been restored to the Marauders at Saircor, and Keivan needs help with the final step of the operation. Fight off the Ancient Guardians and assist with the repairs so he can gain control of their defenses.
I fear no man! But the army of beasts forming on that mountain below? They scare me. It will be a colossal relief when these defenses are ours.
If only the sluggards below could finish the mission.
The Ancient Guardians gave our little friends trouble with sickness and sabotage, but now they once again face the might of the Marauders!
If you can aid me while I study this mechanism, Saircor and its defenses will be ours.
"You’re dealing with complex traps?"
Looks can be deceiving, da? This will not be easy, friend. You have demonstrated mastery over Ancient Guardians. Show us Marauders another performance!
If you help us repair this Ancient device, we will be ready to proceed.
Every moment we delay, our foes continue their relentless advance. The man-beast to the north must not be allowed to amass his armies unchecked.
I've unlocked some rooms but we need more. These runes seem to indicate danger. I need to maintain control of this apparatus.
Go and repair what you can. And if it's not too much trouble… bring me a drink, da?
Ah, delicious water. Friend, you are carrying this mission on your back.
Our enemies will know our location the moment we take control of these devices. When you are ready, we will humiliate them on both fronts.
Haha! Run, cowards! Though I take great pride in Marauder victory over the Ancient Guardians, I am even more impressed by the strength of Aeternum united.
We could not have done this without you and our allies.
With what you have accomplished here, we should be able to contain the beasts of this island.
We will next turn our attention towards our siege on Hornhold.

Bring Kievan his drink
You have seen Taurus, da? I beat him in, let's say, small competition. He owes me money. Looking for work or wares yourself?
Ramla is elsewhere, Covenant. Though if I ever need more ruins charted or stones observed, I'll be certain to look for one of you.
Ah, I owe you Syndicate a great deal for helping me take control of the Saircor runes.
It is seldom I am able to control Ancient devices. I am grateful for the opportunity!

THE HEART OF A BEAST
The Heart of a Beast

Pinned beneath a mysterious, rusted axe lies a note - addressed to you. It asks that you hold your judgment of the fabled Minotaur until you learn his story. Collect relics lost in the labyrinth, then speak with Marwa.
A carefully-written note is pinned by a large axe.
(Examine the note.)
“The Minotaur could be a force of wanton destruction, but he chooses not to be. He is hunted purely due to lies and falsehoods.
The labyrinth contains relics that hold the truth. Bring them to me and I shall reveal his legacy.” -Marwa
The note instructs you to find three relics within the labyrinth and deliver them to Marwa.
Do not believe what you hear about the minotaur. He is a noble soul who has endured great trials.
Taurus… Minotaur… Enkidu... he has gone by many names. I healed him after he was attacked in Weaver’s Fen decades ago. Now we fight side by side.
He seeks a life undisturbed, but I fear the serpent woman has other plans for him.
Taurus once lived among the beasts before becoming an outcast. He yearns for the respect of all his kind, both beast and human.

Challenge of Character

Marwa Shaheen has heard of your recent exploits, and knows more trials lie ahead. She wishes to offer a challenge to bolster your resolve. Visit Marwa and complete the time trial that she has prepared.
<g id="female_crossarms" />Taurus has informed me of Mahantaram's fate, and how Kurok has followed him down <g id="female_gestureDown" />into the caverns below the mountain.
<g id="male_fistpumpRight" />You must steel yourself for the trials that lie ahead. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Might I offer a challenge to test your strength of character?

<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />Traveling through this land is grueling task, even for the strongest among us.<g id="female_leanforwardListen" /> Do you wish to train again. Keep up your strength?
"I'm always ready for a challenge."
<g id="male_itemGiveRight" />Take this torch and light the braziers I have placed across this land.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />Start south past Saircor, then follow the course to the southern goal. <g id="male_explain" />The path will test your strength, agility, and cunning. Be prepared.
"Let's hope for a record."
<g id="male_quidproquo" />All the braziers must be lit before the flame dies.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Prove that you have the skills to survive this unforgiving place and I will have something for you when you return.
<g id="female_order" />Your flame dwindles. Hasten to the braziers!
<g id="female_headnodding" />Masterfully done. You have no doubt gained favor with Taurus. <g id="female_giveitem" />Here is your reward.
<g id="male_quidproquo" />Return again to test yourself further. Maintaining this routine will keep your edge sharpened for battle. <g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />But for now, rest.
Back so soon? <g id="female_headnodding" />I admire your dedication, <g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />but it is important to let your body fully recover.

GAUNTLET OF KINGS
Gauntlet of Kings
Shirzad believes you must increase in strength if you are to quell the rage of the tainted Beast Lords and their tribes. Return to his den at Gurhaowl's Pride and once again brave the grotto below.
Kurok went below Highmound, certain he could pull Mahantaram up from the depths. Neither has returned.
If rage has consumed them, they need to be dealt with, lest their malevolence seep into the land around them.
"I will do what I must."
I do not wish this fate upon them, but the natural cycle must be restored. You will need to be stronger than ever.
Brave my gauntlet once more. Prove yourself against not only beast, but your fellow man, and I will grant you my boon.
Come to brave the gauntlet again, little lion?
"No beast or man will stop me."
Then descend once more into the caverns of my kin, and defeat any who stand in your way. Do not relent and you shall be victorious.
Prove yourself worthy to defend those in your charge!
The idle are not fit to lead.
Once again you prove yourself a mighty warrior. Perhaps you have the soul of a lion? You have my boon, human. Be welcome in my domain.
You are a mighty soul indeed. Rest, now upon the rocks. Soak in the sun and remember why you fight. You may brave the gauntlet again tomorrow.

Battle of the Beasts

Barug of the Gorillas now stands in Kurok's stead, but without their Lord the tribe is in grave danger. Rally your fellow warriors to help the Gorilla tribe fight off an incursion by a champion of the Lizard Lord.
Kurok has followed Mahantaram into the Crystalclaw Caverns. Something feels… wrong.
With Kurok gone, our enemies believe we are weak. Even now Gazsala Thiss, a champion of the Lizard Lord Sirrussu seeks to capitalize on our disarray.
These are our lands. Would you aid us in holding back this invader?
Relentless as always, Gazsala Thiss has returned to our shores. Will you join us in defending our homes once more?
"I will conquer the beast."
With most of our allied Lords sequestered in the cavern, our tribe remains in great danger. Fight Gazsala in the bay. Fight with everything you have.
I struggle to maintain order in Nyhart's without Kurok. If Sirrussu spreads his malign influence here, others of their kind will surely invade.
My thanks, human. I offer you our boon. We weep for the Lords that are lost, and hope they may return to us in time. We need their guidance now more than ever.
You fought boldly. But other champions can hold the line for now. Go. Rest. Help yourself to something to eat.

The Tribunal Highmound

Manmosu, the new matriarch of the mammoth tribe, has taken refuge in a cave near the Tribunal Highmound to prepare for battle. Speak with her, and then prepare to assault the Highmound and its leaders.
This foulness twists and turns more than a dryad lost in a thicket.
I fear our immediate threat is not inside the cavern, but above it.
This sinister magic has seeped through rock and soil to infect the beasts that claim the Highmound. We must clear the area before it’s impossible to contain.
"Then we need to hurry."
You think as I do, human. Focus on eliminating the leaders. Their contagion spreads quickly if they are left to prowl.
Do this, and you will stop it long enough for us to deal with the greater threat within the Savage Divide.
Maintain dominance or this land will dominate you.
Impressive. I wish more within the herd had your conviction. It’s time to face the Lords within their new domain.
I grieve that it has come to this, but… they can be allowed to disrupt the primal flow no longer.

Medusa's Monstrosities

Johannes Metzger needs assistance investigating the sinister magic Medusa had been channeling in Scalefang Enclave. Reach out to the rogue scientist, help him gather samples, and work with the mysterious technology there.
The Syndicate said my scientific pursuits were too extreme. They called me unhinged. Can you believe it?
It's slander! And all because I refuse to allow a silly thing like ethics to hold back progress.
Ach! Don't sneak up on me like that. Can't you see I’m deep in thought?
I've been trying to find a way to gather Hercyne samples without suffering grievous bodily harm. I don't suppose a warrior like yourself would be interested in helping?
"What do you mean by samples?"
Limbs. Guts. Brains. What else? You've skinned a deer before, yes? It's like that, but keep the bits you'd throw out.
I just need a few more of each, then we can move on to the next phase. Do this and I'll mention you in the treatise I'm authoring!
You will not find the Hercyne by nettling me further, assistant. Get moving!
You have an uncanny aptitude for dissection. These samples are perfect! By studying these component parts I'll learn the intricacies of merging with Angry Earth.
Return when you're ready and we'll investigate Hercyne memory loss.

Johannes Metzger has even grander ambitions. Too grand to accomplish alone. Find him in the dark village and Help him with his final tasks, and he promises to share part of the credit for whatever he learns.
Ah. I have more work for my favorite living assistant. It involves your specialty - brutal carnage!
We will be meddling with the gorgon's magic, so I hope you're prepared for a grand scientific achievement.
"I'm as ready as I'll ever be."
That's the spirit! There are pylons like mine scattered around Scalefang Enclave.
If you modify them to my exact specifications, no one will notice the slight decrease in power. But we will have access to Medusa's streams of magic!
Hop to, assistant! You know what they say about idle hands…

The Siege of Light's Crown

Ranger-Captain Hargest has advanced into inner Light's Crown to establish a perimeter, but she needs assistance. Help the rangers restock their munitions, bolster their defenses, and fend off attacks.
<g id="male_explain" />We have sacrificed much to get here. We need to fortify this position or it will all be for nothing. <g id="male_convince01" />Help us establish a perimeter or we're done for.
"On it!"
<g id="female_gestureLeft" />We can use these barricades to create a choke point. <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />We need to funnel the enemy into cannon range.

<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />The cannon needs to be assembled first, but that firepower along with my rangers should be-
<g id="male_lookaroundStartled01" priority="high" />Wait, where is the supply wagon? We can't hold for long without ammunition.
"I’ll find it."
<g id="female_headnodding" />You'd better, or this is going to be a long night.
<g id="male_explain" />Come back to me after you've fixed the barricades and supplied our rangers, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />and I’ll be sure to have the cannon ready when you return.
<g id="male_convince01" />Once this cannon is operational, <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />we will command the battlefield.
These wagons weren’t built for this blasted terrain. The wheel's broken. I need someone to cover me so I can fix it.

Thanks, friend. I’m better with a bow than I am with a wrench, but I’ll make it work.
Almost got it! Just keep them off me a bit longer.
Even with the repairs, this wagon can’t make it up there. I’ll have to return to camp and find another way to resupply our troops.

Help yourself. It’ll lighten the load.
I need to get out of here before more show up.
The cannon is ready.

My scouts spotted forces heading this way. <g id="female_order" />Open fire!
<g id="male_compliment" />Excellent work! We've got a much stronger foothold here now. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Your quick thinking saved the day.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />This new position should discourage hostile movement through the region.
<g id="male_explain" />Hopefully we won’t need to use that much firepower again. But if we do, I know who to call upon. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Until then, keep well my friend.

Heinrich Gauss has been dispatched to investigate the dark energy pouring out of Elafry Pyrgo and assess its potential danger to the humans of Aeternum. Help him to gather samples using his proprietary capture devices.
<g id="male_lookUpAround" />The storm is transforming! I’ve never seen the skies of Aeternum look so bafflingly arcane.
<g id="female_nodConsider" />I must capture this energy to study its composition. <g id="female_shakeheadNo" />But I wouldn’t stand a chance against all the beasts and monstrosities within the tower.

<g id="male_explain" />Place it in energy rich regions atop the tower and buy some time for it to capture the storm's essence. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Be careful. The power will coalesce around it.
<g id="male_beckonUrgent" />You mustn't linger long. I want to capture the storm's full ferocity.
<g id="male_salute2FingersFast" />Were you successful in collecting the… <g id="female_lookConcern" />you look like you’ve seen a ghost. What happened up there?

<g id="female_notsure" />Spirits? Let me see those readings… <g id="female_lookConcern" />This is something new indeed. The energy is dark and cold in nature. Just being near it saps the life right out of me.

Containing the Contagion (Expedition)

Archdruid Trahern has been hard at work researching methods for combating the magical plants spreading throughout the Savage Divide. He needs your assistance planting his newly created seeds within the depths of the cavern.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />I’ve been so focused on reversing the effects of Medusa’s putrid magic that I overlooked a basic principle of nature.
"What principle?"
<g id="male_spreadhands" />There can be no growth without decay and vice versa.
"How does that help?"
<g id="male_explain" />We use Medusa’s magic against her. These seeds will absorb the taint and purify it before bursting into pristine flora.
<g id="female_explainS" />Simply place them where the contagion is most concentrated and allow nature to take its course.

<g id="female_disagreeRighthandout" />Be careful, there are many infected creatures inside the cavern. If at all possible, try to give them a swift end. <g id="male_shakehead" />They've already suffered enough.
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I’m glad you made it back safely. The seeds should prevent new infections from spreading.
I hope our paths cross again… under less dire circumstances. May the wilds<g id="male_salute2FingersFast" /> always guide you, friend.

<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />We have made progress towards restoring the balance of this land, but much more remains to be done. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> I look forward to more partnerships, dear friend.

THE SAVAGE DIVIDE
The Savage Divide (Expedition)

The time has come to face the Beast Lords lost within the Savage Divide. Manmosu asks that we act as her champion, lest she risk infection by going herself. Gather your greatest allies, descend into the Divide, and defeat the Lords.
Whatever Mahantaram succumbed to has enraged him beyond the point of return. He has become a major threat to my kind... and yours.
We must sever his connection to the herd, even if that means destroying him.
"Leave him to me."
Unfortunately, he isn’t the only Beast Lord within the depths of the Highmound Caverns. The gorilla lord Kurok is inside as well.
I’d die protecting my herd, but I fear contracting their disease.
Stay vigilant. You may have defeated Mahantaram before, but the foulness festering within him makes him unpredictable.
You must leave this place!
Rage burns within me!
Will this never end?
A moment… to rest…
Your kind will never change!
The age of humanity is over!
Your bones will crack beneath me!
One day... I will revive... my people.
I can feel his grip weakening on the herd. With time, the power he holds over us will diminish.
It still shocks me to fight alongside a human, but you have proven yourself a priceless ally. You have my gratitude.
Mahantaram will return, which means we must remain true to our convictions. His link to the tribe must be severed completely.
Enter the Savage Divide
Destroy the afflicted Beast Lords in the Savage Divide
Defeat Kurok
Defeat Mahantaram
AMONG THE STATUES
Among the Statues
Dame Edith Henrietta Shackleton has gotten herself into a bit of a situation in the maze. She requires help acquiring antiquities that have been turned to stone.
<g id="female_shhUrgent" />Shhh, you mustn't let them know I'm not a statue. Now shoo!
<g id="female_outfitproud" />I, who have never gotten lost in my life, was challenged to make it through this most devious maze by my rival Bloodgood.
I fear nothing, of course, but I ran into a slight problem. It turns out that <g id="female_shocked" />dreaded gorgon is real! How was I to know truth and mythology overlapped?
"Why aren't you stone?"
<g id="male_nodProud" />I'm no dunce. I studied the Classics, and have an encyclopedic knowledge of mythology.
While I may have been surprised to see it was real, I know how to use a hand mirror. <g id="female_clasphandsConvince" />But I could use some help.
"You need to get out?"
<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" />Heavens no! I cannot leave without the intriguing artifacts I came for. If I left without them, I'd never hear the end of it from Bloodgood, curse him.
With so many adventurers turned to stone here, <g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" />this is the perfect area to recover artifacts from all sorts of fascinating cultures.
<g id="female_impatient" />Have you recovered those artifacts yet? I'm getting tired from holding this position.
<g id="male_compliment" />Splendid work! Just splendid! Imagine, this vase, if it hasn't been turned to stone, would have been as fragile as an eggshell.
<g id="male_secretive" priority="high" />Now I can study the intricate design without fear of it shattering. Or Bloodgood's bumbling.
<g id="grace_dismiss" />Oh don't worry about me. I've been in worse positions. Though do speak a little quieter, I am supposed to be a statue after all.
Collect {itemName} from the maze
MISC
I have seen many types of magic during my time on Aeternum.<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> This one stretches beyond my knowledge.
My soldiers and I are here to keep the invaders at bay. We heard about the demise of the First Light settlement and we can't allow that to happen to the others.
This stew is missing… texture. A batch of frogs legs and a sprinkle of trout eyes ought to give it a nice chew.
I admit this is different from healing a rabbit's wound, <g id="male_explain" />but my experience tending to animals seems to be effective on the human body as well.
Ah, finally someone who looks competent enough to use these masterfully crafted arms. I’ll be sure to save the good stuff for you.
I've heard there's game the size of three bisons not far from here.
Sure it'll take a wagon load of spices to season the meat properly, but you'll get to enjoy it for weeks.
Look at all the possibilities. Like that one over there. If it has healing properties, a mender would pay a fortune for it.
And if it kills, <g id="female_smackfist" />well there's always a market for that.
Stay vigilant! The growth seeks to destroy us if we are not careful.
We are here to defend the warcamp. Nothing will get past us.
Welcome aboard, comrade. Where would you like to set sail? Looking for some work-for-hire, or supplies perhaps?
Covenant give themselves away just from the walk. Not a one of you has sea legs. Should be ashamed of yourselves.
Move along potion crafter. If you're here to peddle goods made from Tarwater, I'm not interested.
Ah, well met fellow chemist! I'd offer you some daily deals but I know what you're here for. Do you seek assignment, or tools of the trade?
Covenant? I have draughts you won't find at the trading post. One will keep you warm on long nights pilfering ruins!
Or perhaps you'd be interested in a cream to keep the Ancients away? All for a low price! No?
Ah. Marauder? You could do with a potion of stone skin! Any blade that dares strike your flesh would shatter to pieces.
You'll just need to eat two raw eggs a day as well to counteract the-- Are you paying attention?
Hail, traveler. Keep your mind sharp and your blade sharper. The wilderness shows no mercy. Do you seek noble works, or perhaps requisition?
I've seen the Alchemist's ilk before. You learn from his snake oil precisely once... I will never buy that "fire in a bottle" again.
You "land pirates" are a confusing bunch. Your commander speaks highly of the sea's freedom, yet all of us were deposited here by the uncaring waves.
What freedom is found in a path to Aeternum?
ARTEMIS PLANT WHISPERS
Prove your strength, children of Kurok. In this land those who are strong thrive.
Take what you wish from the humans of the island, for their time has come to an end.
Like the last vestiges of weak flora of this land before, the remaining humans here resist their evolution.
Fear not, my children, for they too will yield their lifeforce to the Elysian Wilds.
Watch your steps as you navigate the wretched imprint the humans stamped onto the earth here.
We will rain down terror on this dreadful little town until not a trace of humanity remains.
Drag these Lost souls deep beneath the rivers and ponds, into the mud and earth below.
Let them feed the bugs, and nourish more deserving life with their feeble essence.
Be wary, children of Mahantaram. What you seek to rebuild comes fraught with danger.
Even now the humans scramble over our walls, eager for tusk and fur. Do you remember?
The humans waste not a moment before invading our new home, taking our children from our dens.
Their instincts, who and what they are - it will never change. Destroy them to secure your territory in the Elysian Wilds.
Let no human tread upon the soil of our sanctum. Capture any who would dare!
This island, this world, immortality, they were always meant for you. Fight for me, my chosen!
Move forth into this world, reborn. Let our influence shield you from the darkness of Corruption.
You are the sons and daughters of this land, reap what is rightfully yours.
The final hour is nigh, and the defilers have arrived! So small and hopeless.
They cannot possibly fathom what awaits. Show them the rage of the earth!
Let none ascend this tower! Protect your matron, my children, and I will give you your kingdom!
Strangle from them their very breath! Use every thorn to bleed them dry!
